metadata.Title: CVE-2022-40959 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
During iframe navigation, certain pages did not have their FeaturePolicy fully initialized leading to a bypass that leaked device permissions into untrusted subdocuments. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 102.3, Thunderbird < 102.3, and Firefox < 105.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40959` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.4.2+build2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
